nodes.name: India's health indicators
nodes.explanation: Improved but lag behind peer nations.

nodes.name: WHO threshold
nodes.explanation: Recommended 44.5 doctors, nurses, and midwives per 10,000 population.

nodes.name: Public health sector
nodes.explanation: Underfunded, provides healthcare to vulnerable populations.

nodes.name: Private health sector
nodes.explanation: Dominant provider of healthcare, perceived to provide quality care.

nodes.name: National Health Mission (NHM)
nodes.explanation: Aims to increase healthcare services, focuses on primary healthcare.

nodes.name: Accredited Social Health Activists (ASHA)
nodes.explanation: Female community health workers, serve to increase reach of healthcare.

nodes.name: Auxiliary Nurse Midwives (ANM)
nodes.explanation: Healthcare workers serving a population of 5,000 to 20,000 people.

nodes.name: Rural Medical Assistants (RMA)
nodes.explanation: Contractual health workers, similar to physician assistants.

nodes.name: National Medical Council (NMC)
nodes.explanation: Replaced Medical Commission, aims to improve regulation of health professionals.

nodes.name: Ayushman Bharat
nodes.explanation: Publicly financed health insurance scheme for the poor.

nodes.name: National Health Protection Mission
nodes.explanation: Limited uptake, majority of Indians still without health insurance.

nodes.name: Digital technologies
nodes.explanation: Used to facilitate vaccination programs and enhance personalized care.

nodes.name: Telemedicine
nodes.explanation: Increased during COVID-19, helps overcome healthcare access barriers.

edges.content: India's health indicators are below the WHO threshold.
Public health sector issues contribute to India's lagging health indicators.
Private health sector issues also contribute to India's lagging health indicators.
NHM created ASHAs to increase healthcare reach.
NHM utilizes ANMs for healthcare services.
NHM employs RMAs for primary healthcare.
NMC aims to improve regulation to address health indicators.
Ayushman Bharat targets improved health indicators.
National Health Protection Mission is part of Ayushman Bharat.
Digital technologies can improve India's health indicators.
Telemedicine can improve healthcare access and health indicators.
